title: Fake doctor is arrested over 'botched' $800 butt enlargement
text:
Ena Boulton, 60, is accused of injecting the 33-year-old victim, Mariela Alonso, with a synthetic filler at her home in Hialeah, Florida back in August 2018

A fake doctor has been arrested after she allegedly botched an $800 butt enlargement procedure that nearly killed the patient and left her in a medically-induced coma for two months.

Ena Boulton, 60, is accused of injecting the 33-year-old victim, Mariela Alonso, with a synthetic filler at her home in Hialeah, Florida back in August 2018.

Police said Boulton was practicing medicine in her home without a license and that the filler used during the procedure is not FDA approved.

The victim told police that she paid Boulton $800 for the butt enhancement procedure, Local10 reports.

Boulton allegedly injected the victim with Bio-Alcamid, which is a cosmetic surgery filler that is known to have adverse risks, while she was lying face-down on her bed.

Following the procedure, the victim reported experiencing severe pain and Boulton allegedly advised her to drink sugared water.

When the victim started vomiting blood, Boulton is accused of telling her that she would be okay.

The victim, Mariela Alonso, was left in a medically-induced coma for two months following the botched procedure

Mariela Alonso (above) said she was left with speech impairment, motor skills deficiency and contracture deformities following the botched procedure

Soon after, the victim was then diagnosed and treated in hospital for pneumonia.

After taking an antibiotic, the victim started complaining of a shortness of breath.

She was rushed to hospital but by the time she arrived her condition had deteriorated.

She was placed in a medically-induced coma with no brain activity.

When she woke from the coma two months later, she told police that Boulton was the one who performed the procedure.

The victim said she was left with speech impairment, motor skills deficiency and contracture deformities following the botched procedure.

Police said Boulton admitted to administering the filler.

She is now facing charges of practice of a health care profession without a license causing serious injury and medicine practice without a license.
